original: Carlgren, Helge Nils 0’skar, stadsarkitekt, Kalmar, f. 7/2/02 i Stockholm av prof. Oskar Henrik C. o. Helga Linder. — Stud:ex. v. h. a. 1. i Lund 21, fil. kand. i Lund 24, avg:ex. fr. KTH 28, fr. konsthögsk. 31. Anst. h. länsarkit. Nils A. Blanck i Malmö, v. Skansens ritkont. i Sthlm, h. arkit. E. Fant i Sthlm o. provtjg. å byggn:-styr, stadsplanebyrå, bitr. länsarkit. i Jönköp. o. Österg. 1. distr. i Linköp. 36, stadsarkit. i Kalmar sed. 37. Medl. av Sv. tekn:för. fr. 34.
translated: Carlgren, Helge Nils 0'skar, city architect of Kalmar, born on February 7th, 1902 in Stockholm to Professor Oskar Henrik C. and Helga Linder. He passed his studentexamen at Lund Cathedral School in 1921, got his Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1924, and graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1928. He also attended the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Stockholm in 1931. He worked at the County Architect's Office of Nils A. Blanck in Malmö, the design department of Skansen in Stockholm, the architect E. Fant in Stockholm, and worked as a trainee at the Building Control, City Planning Bureau, Assistant County Architect of Jönköping, and the 1st district of Östergötland in Linköping in 1936. He has been the city architect of Kalmar since 1937. He has been a member of the Swedish Society of Technology since 1934.

workLocation.name: County Architect's Office of Nils A. Blanck
